column1:
Odeinoichus,"2017-08-23T16:48:36.54Z","Admirable Effort","

Set #30551 Cinderella’s Kitchen: Here’s an interesting Polybag. Previous Disney Princess’ sets have been based on more modern films, Rapunzel and Frozen respectively. This is the first classic Princess set given the Polybag treatment and we’ll cover all of the pros and cons of the set during the course of this review.
Pros:

column2: Includes a small Kitchen model and table to play with.
Model featured uses nice pieces with impressive build techniques, could be likened to some of the better models in past LEGO Friends Advent Calendars.
Pink Teapot included.
Cinderella Mini-Doll included in a cheap set.

column1: Cons:

column2: Cinderella is not a unique Mini-Doll, missed opportunity to give us Cinderella in her regular outfit from the beginning of the film.
No seats to sit at the little table.

column1: Overall opinion

This is a nice polybag from the Disney Princess Theme, but I question the inclusion of Cinderella in her ball gown to bake treats for herself or her wicked step-sisters. It would have been nice if this was a unique print with Cinderella in her regular outfit as she was only seen in the kitchen dressed in her work clothes with apron and it would have been nice to see that look in Mini-Doll form, including a longer looking hair piece to better capture her appearance seen during those moments of the film.

Still I have to give LEGO effort for giving us a Cinderella Mini-Doll for only 5$ with a little kitchen playset to explore. There’s even a hidden letter behind the fire in the hearth, perhaps the invitation to the ball kept secret from Lady Tremaine? Who can truly say? Mildly recommended.
